author: Special Correspondent
text:
The Lashkar-e-Toiba (LeT) on Tuesday claimed that the group carried out the Pampore attack to avenge two civilian killings that took place during a counter-insurgency operation in Pulwama district on February 15.

LeT chief Mehmood Shah, in a statement issued in Srinagar, said: “Captain Pawan Kumar was responsible for the killings of Shaista Hamid and Danish Farooq. Militants have paid back by avenging their deaths.”

Hamid and Farooq were killed during protests in Pulwama during a counter-insurgency operation, which left a militant dead. Two militants fled from the encounter site due to civilian protests.

Meanwhile, the Kashmir University students offered funeral prayers for the slain militants of the Pampore attack. Similar prayers in absentia were also held in several places.
title: ‘Attack to avenge civilian killings’
